page.title: 16Birds in this Newburgh Area
page.content: This area,which contains the estuary of the River Ythan, is popular with ornithologists.Some of the birds which come to nest here are Heron,Eider duck,Swans,Oystercatchers and Sparrows There are some other rare species of birds.Eider Road,Mavis Bank,Curlew Avenue and Laverock Road were named after the birds that come here.Part of the estuary forms Forvie Nature Reserve where Terns are protected during the nesting season.Lead weights used by fishermen cause the death of some birds. Once some black Swans that had escaped from a Zoo came to the estuary.Pectoral Sandpiper has been seen only once in Newburgh.It is a very rare bird. There is a Heron resident in this area.It stays near the river estuary in Newburgh.
